Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that Bernie Sanders never held a "9-5 job" and lived off welfare before being elected. While it is true that Sanders did not have a traditional 9-5 job, he did work odd jobs before his political career began and served as the mayor of Burlington, Vermont.
Understate: The claim understates Bernie Sanders' accomplishments by stating that he hasn't proposed a single bill that passed. While it is true that not all of his proposed bills have passed, Sanders has had several bills that he sponsored or co-sponsored become law, including the Veterans Access, Choice, and Accountability Act of 2014.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support for its assertion that Bernie Sanders lived off welfare before being elected. There is no evidence provided to support this claim.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes a problematic assumption by comparing Bernie Sanders to Karl Marx and suggesting that he has "succeeded at nothing." This assumption is subjective and lacks factual basis.
Exist alternative explanation: There could be alternative explanations for why Bernie Sanders did not have a traditional 9-5 job before being elected. It could be due to his involvement in activism and political work, rather than a lack of effort or ability to hold such a job.
